Package Project2

Class Table

java.lang.Object
Project2.Table
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Table extends Object implements Serializable
The Table class implements relational database tables (including attribute names, domains and a list of tuples. Five basic relational algebra operators are provided: project, select, union, minus and join. The insert data manipulation operator is also provided. Missing are update and delete data manipulation operators.
See Also:

    • Table

      public Table(String _name, String[] _attribute, Class[] _domain, String[] _key)
      Construct an empty table from the meta-data specifications.
      Parameters:
      _name - the name of the relation
      _attribute - the string containing attributes names
      _domain - the string containing attribute domains (data types)
      _key - the primary key

    • Table

      public Table(String _name, String[] _attribute, Class[] _domain, String[] _key, List<Comparable[]> _tuples)
      Construct a table from the meta-data specifications and data in _tuples list.
      Parameters:
      _name - the name of the relation
      _attribute - the string containing attributes names
      _domain - the string containing attribute domains (data types)
      _key - the primary key
      _tuples - the list of tuples containing the data

  • Method Details

    • concat

      public static <T> T[] concat(T[] arr1, T[] arr2)
      Concatenate two arrays of type T to form a new wider array.
      Parameters:
      arr1 - the first array
      arr2 - the second array
      Returns:
      a wider array containing all the values from arr1 and arr2

    • project

      public Table project(String attributes)
      Project the tuples onto a lower dimension by keeping only the given attributes. Check whether the original key is included in the projection. #usage movie.project ("title year studioNo")
      Parameters:
      attributes - the attributes to project onto
      Returns:
      a table of projected tuples

    • select

      public Table select(Predicate<Comparable[]> predicate)
      Select the tuples satisfying the given predicate (Boolean function). #usage movie.select (t -> t[movie.col("year")].equals (1977))
      Parameters:
      predicate - the check condition for tuples
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the predicate

    • select

      public Table select(String condition)
      Select the tuples satisfying the given simple condition on attributes/constants compared using an ==, !=, <, <=, >, >=. #usage movie.select ("year == 1977")
      Parameters:
      condition - the check condition as a string for tuples
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the condition

    • select

      public Table select(KeyType keyVal)
      Select the tuples satisfying the given key predicate (key = value). Use an index (Map) to retrieve the tuple with the given key value. INDEXED SELECT ALGORITHM.
      Parameters:
      keyVal - the given key value
      Returns:
      a table with the tuple satisfying the key predicate

    • union

      public Table union(Table table2)
      Union this table and table2. Check that the two tables are compatible. #usage movie.union (show)
      Parameters:
      table2 - the rhs table in the union operation
      Returns:
      a table representing the union

    • minus

      public Table minus(Table table2)
      Take the difference of this table and table2. Check that the two tables are compatible. #usage movie.minus (show)
      Parameters:
      table2 - The rhs table in the minus operation
      Returns:
      a table representing the difference

    • join

      public Table join(String attributes1, String attributes2, Table table2)
      Join this table and table2 by performing an "equi-join". Tuples from both tables are compared requiring attributes1 to equal attributes2. Disambiguate attribute names by appending "2" to the end of any duplicate attribute name. Implement using a NESTED LOOP JOIN ALGORITHM. #usage movie.join ("studioName", "name", studio)
      Parameters:
      attributes1 - the attributes of this table to be compared (Foreign Key)
      attributes2 - the attributes of table2 to be compared (Primary Key)
      table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the equality predicate

    • join

      public Table join(String condition, Table table2)
      Join this table and table2 by performing a "theta-join". Tuples from both tables are compared attribute1 attribute2. Disambiguate attribute names by appending "2" to the end of any duplicate attribute name. Implement using a Nested Loop Join algorithm. #usage movie.join ("studioName == name", studio)
      Parameters:
      condition - the theta join condition
      table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the condition

    • i_join

      public Table i_join(String attributes1, String attributes2, Table table2)
      Join this table and table2 by performing an "equi-join". Same as above equi-join, but implemented using an INDEXED JOIN ALGORITHM.
      Parameters:
      attributes1 - the attributes of this table to be compared (Foreign Key)
      attributes2 - the attributes of table2 to be compared (Primary Key)
      table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the equality predicate

    • h_join

      public Table h_join(String attributes1, String attributes2, Table table2)
      Join this table and table2 by performing an "equi-join". Same as above, but implemented using a Hash Join algorithm.
      Parameters:
      attributes1 - the attributes of this table to be compared (Foreign Key)
      attributes2 - the attributes of table2 to be compared (Primary Key)
      table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the equality predicate

    • join

      public Table join(Table table2)
      Join this table and table2 by performing an "natural join". Tuples from both tables are compared requiring common attributes to be equal. The duplicate column is also eliminated. #usage movieStar.join (starsIn)
      Parameters:
      table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
      Returns:
      a table with tuples satisfying the equality predicate

    • col

      public int col(String attr)
      Return the column position for the given attribute name or -1 if not found.
      Parameters:
      attr - the given attribute name
      Returns:
      a column position

    • insert

      public boolean insert(Comparable[] tup)
      Insert a tuple to the table. #usage movie.insert ("Star_Wars", 1977, 124, "T", "Fox", 12345)
      Parameters:
      tup - the array of attribute values forming the tuple
      Returns:
      whether insertion was successful

      public String getName()
      Get the name of the table.
      Returns:
      the table's name

      public void print()
      Print this table.

      public void printIndex()
      Print this table's index (Map).

      public static Table load(String name)
      Load the table with the given name into memory.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the table to load

      Save this table in a file.
